intro: Argostemma tortilobum, commonly known as the twisted-lobed argostemma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
